name: deimosrising
text: This is a really "experimental" phase in the Achewood history, with a lot of silent panels and atmospherics. It's really this kind of stuff, even more than the humor, that elevates the strip above what I laughingly call its peers.

name: shmuckeles
text: and the chubby award goes to YOU

name: ford
text: seconded

name: killerlimpet
text: A comment left by killerlimpet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by boatshow, Sweetlips, Boyd)

name: idsyen
text: Achewood is by far the place with the highest concentration of Bill Hicks fans. He's even an example of a comedian in the profile window, for Pete's sake. Your avatar makes me feel like, when I'm reading the archives, old Bill himself is looking down on us from Arizona Bay. Thank you, ford.

name: ford
text: Thanks to this comment i am currently re-listening to "Arizona Bay." Thank YOU, idsyen.

name: radarjammer
text: Has anyone ever looked at the back side of Led Zeppelin 3 and thought Jimmy Page looked a LOT like Bill Hicks? His eyes and mouth, especially.

name: giltron
text: another dead hero.

name: duperando
text:
Whoever lamed it... well, I won't go there.
CHUBBY'D.

name: saint
text: i honestly did not see robert johnson in the last panel, and when I did, I jumped a little myself.

name: aliiis
text:
You did not...

See

name: zedpower
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: atticusonline
text: oh hee hee, oh heee heee heeee

name: dtuba
text: Achewood has no peers. It is the Beatles of webcomics.

name: cbtbone
text: This one is so excellent.  The Robert Johnson storyline could have been so great, but it fizzled out.  Too bad.

name: catachresis
text: Why are so few of these strips rated highly

name: sakana
text: People are just naturally going to react more to a witty catch phrase than a subtly crafted composition. At the end of the day, this is really more of a hilarious comic than a melancholy contemplation.

name: wolfslice
text: This is my absolute favorite strip. Got this one framed.

name: the_voice
text: Hey me too! I think this is the silent pinnacle of achewood.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Who stole the G?

name: liquidcruelty
text: Why couldn't this story arc have been longer, I loved it so ;_;

name: zsp3c
text: I love Ray's hat!!  Anyone else?

name: prolefeed5
text: It is extremely smart, I will admit...

name: carlyle
text:
What is it? It looks like an alpini cap, but I don't know why Ray would have one.

But Ray does have a crown for wearing after getting mad rutty, so I could probably see it.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Panel One: In hell there is no G.

name: drskradley
text:
Except in "Lounge". They are merely low on G's in hell.

..."They are low on g's in hell." would make a great gangsta rap song about the afterlife and the choices we make to be hustla's and g's here.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I am also thinking hell without gravity would be kind of novel.
Zero G's in Hell!

name: drskradley
text: The alt text of these past few straight kill me.

name: sargasm
text: In Hell, Robert Johnson is sentenced to an eternity of playing at the Brookside Lounge at Best Western.  Sisyphus looks at him and smiles.

name: nuisancevalue
text:
I don't think anybody has mentioned that this is an excellent punishment for selling your soul in exchange for musical talent.

An eternity of bookings at an out of the way motel, but it's closed, and you never get to play again...

name: gopacapulco
text: e p i c

name: peecat
text:
Trawling through the archives, and *this* is the one that made me join up just so I could say...

I love this strip.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: Your avatar is EXACTLY what i drew in my grade 9 science book on the diagram of a vagina. Oh the laughs for generations.

name: peecat
text:
It's a hell of angry vagina, that's for sure.

We had second hand texts that the school gave us to use - this was in one of them... still makes me laugh! I like to think this is how ovaries look most of the time. Angry and possibly homicidal.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: dang maybe you had my book hahaha

name: sabbac
text: Robert Johnson: Sold his soul for the 32-20 blues.  Ray: sold his soul for "dance like there's ass in your pants"

name: thebeans
text: This scene is so fucking rad. I want to go to hell.
